properties.media:imagetext:
PAN AMERICAN
FLIES TO GUAM
REVOLTON
BICEN,
CNNA
1776-1976
Pan American Airways was organized in 1927
to contract for delivery of the U.S. mail from Flori-
da to Cuba. The operation expanded rapidly through-
out the Carribean and soon their sights were set on
the vast expanse of the Pacific. In 1931 the Lind-
berghs surveyed a proposed "Great Circle"' route to
the Orient via Alaska, Japan and China and Pan Am-
erican contracted with both the Martin and Sikorsky
aircraft companies to design and build aircraft suit-
able for long-distance, high-speed, over-water flights.
By the time the first plane was ready to fly in
1935, Japanese hostilities in China necessitated on isl-
and-hopping route to the Orient through the mid-
Pacific so on March 27, 1935 the steamer S.S.
NORTH HAVEN set sail from Pan Am's San Fran-
cisco Bay base of operations at Alameda to establish
seaplane bases at Hawaii, Midway, Wake, Guam and
Manila.
Sikorsky was the first company to fulfill their
contract for Pan Am's new breed of airplanes and on
April 16, 1935 the PAN AMERICAN CLIPPER
lifted off the waters of San Francisco Bay for a sur-
vey flight to Honolulu and return. A second flight
in June reached Midway and in August the third
flight pushed on to Wake. On October 5 the fourth
survey flight left Alameda and eight days later, after
a total flight time of 46 hours and 39 minutes, the
first plane to fly to Guam set down on the waters of
Apra Harbor and taxied to Pan Am's newly complet-
ed base at the sea-side village of Sumay.
On November 22 the Martin company's stream-
lined aircraft christened the CHINA CLIPPER was
ready for its assault on the vast Pacific. Amidst much
fanfare, it took off from San Francisco Bay with a
cargo of 1,837 pounds of mail and on November 27
it reached Guam. After a layover of 39 hours, it took
off for Manila, completing the first trans-Pacific mail
flight at 3:32 p.m. on November 29, 1935.

properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: Pan American World Airways, 45th anniversary of first flight to Guam
